architectural_decisions.title: Microservices Architecture
architectural_decisions.rationale: Designed for scalability, maintainability, and security.

architectural_decisions.title: Use of FastAPI and Pydantic
architectural_decisions.rationale: FastAPI provides efficient and easy-to-use API development, while Pydantic offers robust data validation.

architectural_decisions.title: Repository Pattern Implementation
architectural_decisions.rationale: Abstracts data access layer for better organization and separation of concerns.

architectural_decisions.title: Dependency Injection with FastAPI
architectural_decisions.rationale: Simplifies dependency management and promotes modularity.

architectural_decisions.title: Custom Error Handling with HTTPException
architectural_decisions.rationale: Provides clear and consistent error responses for various scenarios.

architectural_decisions.title: Multi-provider Payment Support
architectural_decisions.rationale: Allows flexibility in choosing payment processors based on specific needs.

architectural_decisions.title: JWT Token Authentication
architectural_decisions.rationale: Ensures secure authentication and authorization for API endpoints.

architectural_decisions.title: ORM for Database Interactions
architectural_decisions.rationale: Facilitates easier and more efficient database operations through abstraction.

architectural_decisions.title: Email Notifications for Order Confirmation
architectural_decisions.rationale: Enhances user experience by notifying customers about successful order creation.

components.name: Orders API
components.description: REST API endpoints for order management in an e-commerce application.

Create and Manage Orders.description: API endpoints for creating and managing orders in an e-commerce application.

steps.description: Create a new order using POST /api/orders/create with request body containing items, shipping address, and payment method.
Retrieve order details using GET /api/orders/{order_id}. Users can only access their own orders.
List all orders for the current user using GET /api/orders/. Supports pagination via limit and offset query parameters.
Cancel a pending order using POST /api/orders/{order_id}/cancel. Orders that are processing or shipped cannot be cancelled.
